page.title: 01Brightwell cum Sotwell
page.content: {Brightwell and Sotwell} are two villages that have joined together. Nearby are the houses of Mackney. The village is near the Town Of Wallingford and lies in the Thames valley. Until the early 1970's the village was in the Royal County of Berkshire, but after the local reorganisation joined Oxfordshire. Oxford City is about 15 miles away. Brightwell cum Sotwell is a very busy village with a wide range of activities for people to take part in, ranging from Cubs and Brownies to the Evergreens for the older folk. There are two shops, two garages, a pub, fruit farms, farms, a furniture builder and the world famous Bach Centre for flower medicine. Nearby Didcot Station with its fast 125 trains to London, makes it a popular commuter village.
